thread.title: Dude's dad is obsessed with a large cube, and Twitter is loving it
thread.title_full: Dude's dad is obsessed with a large cube, and Twitter is loving it

author: Johnny Lieu
title: Dude's dad is obsessed with a large cube, and Twitter is loving it
text:
Did you get yourself a nice Christmas present? Maybe some new underwear or a set of scented candles?
Whatever it was, it pales in comparison to this giant white cube owned by the father of Twitter user Rumoko. Yes, a cube. He loves his cube and evidently, so does Twitter.
SEE ALSO: Website curates all the stares from 'The Office' into a glorious 'stare machine'
Rumoko posted photos of the monolithic cube on Monday, and the tweet has since amassed tens of thousands of retweets and likes.
"My father has a cube (??) and has been taking pictures of it," Rumoko wrote.
my father has a cube (??) and has been taking pictures of it pic.twitter.com/EKWISQNP2a
— RUMOKO (@RUMOKO) January 2, 2017
People seem to really like this father and cube relationship.
@RUMOKO it's a good cube
— Shadow Beauty (@Vulvixa) January 2, 2017
@SteveDelfino @RUMOKO @nickciarelli Obviously not. He is dating the cube.
— Izzy Galvez (@iglvzx) January 2, 2017
@RUMOKO @shmeedlee this really speaks to me. your dad's cube is gorgeous, makes mine look so plain. pic.twitter.com/hZ5Bzq2q6T
— kasmanian devil (@jc4p) January 2, 2017
As for the origins of the cube, it appears to be made out of foam core board and constructed by Rumoko's dad himself.
Why was it made? Well, no one knows.
@HumbleRando he made it himself from foam-core board (I don't know why) cheers
— RUMOKO (@RUMOKO) January 2, 2017
Mashable has contacted Rumoko for further cube comment.
BONUS: This German chef knife is made out of wood
